sentry.description: Sentry error tracking - query errors, analyze patterns, monitor production issues

playwright.description: E2E testing with Playwright - screenshots, navigation, form testing, visual regression

sequential-thinking.description: Enhanced reasoning for complex problems - architecture, debugging, planning

memory.description: Persistent memory across sessions - remember decisions, context, progress

brave-search.description: Web search for documentation, best practices, error solutions

postgres.description: Direct PostgreSQL access - schema inspection, queries, test data

git.description: Git operations - commits, branches, PRs, history

docker.description: Docker container management - start/stop services, logs, health checks

notes.setup: Set environment variables in your shell or .env file. For Sentry, create a User Auth Token at https://sentry.io/settings/account/api/auth-tokens/
required_env_vars: SENTRY_ACCESS_TOKEN - Sentry User Auth Token (requires: org:read, project:read, team:read, event:read, event:write)
BRAVE_API_KEY - Brave Search API key (or use built-in WebSearch)
optional_env_vars: DOCKER_HOST - Custom Docker host (defaults to local)
installation: MCPs are installed automatically via npx -y
First run may take a few seconds to download packages

usage.sentry: Use mcp__sentry__* tools to query errors, create issues
usage.playwright: Use mcp__playwright__* tools for E2E testing, screenshots
usage.sequential_thinking: Automatically invoked for complex reasoning tasks
usage.memory: Use mcp__memory__* tools to remember/recall information
usage.brave_search: Use mcp__brave_search__* tools for web searches
usage.postgres: Use mcp__postgres__* tools for database queries
usage.git: Use mcp__git__* tools for git operations
usage.docker: Use mcp__docker__* tools for container management
